com.idevicesinc.sweetblue

Class BleManager

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.idevicesinc.sweetblue.BleManager

  • public class BleManager
extends Object
    The entry point to the library. Get a singleton instance using get(android.content.Context, BleManagerConfig) or its overloads. Make sure to hook up this manager to lifecycle events for your app as a whole: onPause() and onResume().

    Also put the following entries (or something similar) in the root of your AndroidManifest.xml:

    <uses-sdk android:minSdkVersion="18" android:targetSdkVersion="21" />
    <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.BLUETOOTH" />
    <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.BLUETOOTH_ADMIN" />
    <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.BLUETOOTH_PRIVILEGED" />
    <uses-permission android:name="android.permission.WAKE_LOCK" />
    <uses-feature android:name="android.hardware.bluetooth_le" android:required="true" />


    Manifest.permission.WAKE_LOCK is recommended but optional, needed if BleManagerConfig.manageCpuWakeLock is enabled to aid with reconnect loops. As of now it's enabled by default.


    Then here is a simple example usage:
    
 public class MyActivity extends Activity
 {
      @Override protected void onCreate(Bundle savedInstanceState)
      {
          super.onCreate(savedInstanceState);

          BleManager.get(this).startScan(new ScanFilter()
          {
              @Override public Please onEvent(ScanEvent e)
              {
                  return Please.acknowledgeIf(e.name_normalized().contains("my_device"))
                               .thenStopScan();
              }
          },

          new BleManager.DiscoveryListener()
          {
              @Override public void onEvent(DiscoveryEvent event)
              {
                  if( event.was(LifeCycle.DISCOVERED) )
                  {
                      event.device().connect(new BleDevice.StateListener()
                      {
                          @Override public void onEvent(StateEvent event)
                          {
                              if( event.didEnter(BleDeviceState.INITIALIZED) )
                              {
                                  String toastText = event.device().getDebugName() + " just initialized!";
                                  Toast.makeText(MyActivity.this, toastText, Toast.LENGTH_LONG).show();
                              }
                          }
                      });
                  }
              }
          });
       }

      @Override protected void onResume()
      {
          super.onResume();

          BleManager.get(this).onResume();
      }

      @Override protected void onPause()
      {
          super.onPause();

          BleManager.get(this).onPause();
      }
 }

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class and Description
      static interface  BleManager.AssertListener
      Mostly only for SweetBlue library developers.
      static interface  BleManager.DiscoveryListener
      Provide an implementation to setListener_Discovery(BleManager.DiscoveryListener) to receive callbacks when a device is newly discovered, rediscovered, or undiscovered after calling various startScan() or startPeriodicScan(Interval, Interval) methods.
      static interface  BleManager.ManagerStateListener
      Provide an implementation to setListener_State(BleManager.ManagerStateListener) to receive callbacks when the BleManager undergoes a BleManagerState change.
      static interface  BleManager.NativeStateListener
      Provide an implementation to setListener_NativeState(BleManager.NativeStateListener) to receive callbacks when the BleManager undergoes a *native* BleManagerState change.
      static interface  BleManager.ResetListener
      Provide an implementation to reset(BleManager.ResetListener) to be notified when a reset operation is complete.
      static interface  BleManager.UhOhListener
      Provide an implementation to setListener_UhOh(BleManager.UhOhListener) to receive a callback when an BleManager.UhOhListener.UhOh occurs.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      Object appData
      Field for app to associate any data it wants with the singleton instance of this class instead of having to subclass or manage associative hash maps or something.

      Same as getDevice_previous(BleDevice, BleDeviceState) but allows you to pass a query.
      BleDevice getDevice()
      Forwards getDeviceAt(int) with index of 0.
      BleDevice getDevice(BleDeviceState state)
      Returns the first device that is in the given state, or BleDevice.NULL if no match is found.
      BleDevice getDevice(int mask_BleDeviceState)
      Returns the first device which returns true for BleDevice.isAny(int), or BleDevice.NULL if no such device is found.
      BleDevice getDevice(Object... query)
      Returns the first device that matches the query, or BleDevice.NULL if no match is found.
      BleDevice getDevice(String macAddress)
      Gets a known BleDeviceState.DISCOVERED device by MAC address, or BleDevice.NULL if there is no such device.
      BleDevice getDeviceAt(int index)
      Accessor into the underlying array used to store BleDevice instances.

      Returns the number of devices that are in the current state.
      int getDeviceCount(Object... query)
      Returns the number of devices that match the given query.
      int getDeviceIndex(BleDevice device)
      Returns the index of this device in the internal list, or -1 if it's not found.

      Same as getDevices(ForEach_Void) but will only return devices in the given state provided.

      BleDevice newDevice(String macAddress)
      Same as newDevice(String, String, BleDeviceConfig) but uses an empty string for the name and passes a null BleDeviceConfig, which results in inherited options from BleManagerConfig.

      Same as newHistoricalData(byte[], EpochTime) but tries to use BleNode.newHistoricalData(byte[], EpochTime) if we have a device matching the given mac address.
      void onPause()
      It's generally recommended to call this in your override of Activity.onPause() for each Activity in your application.
      void onResume()
      Opposite of onPause(), to be called from your override of Activity.onResume() for each Activity in your application.
      void popWakeLock()
      Opposite of pushWakeLock(), eventually calls PowerManager.WakeLock.release().
      void pushWakeLock()
      Requires the Manifest.permission.WAKE_LOCK permission.
      void reset()
      This is essentially a big red reset button for the Bluetooth stack.
      void reset(BleManager.ResetListener listener)
      Same as reset() but with a convenience callback for when the reset is completed and the native BLE stack is (should be) back to normal.

      Same as startPeriodicScan(Interval, Interval) but adds a filter too.

      Same as startPeriodicScan(Interval, Interval) but calls setListener_Discovery(BleManager.DiscoveryListener) for you too and adds a filter.
      boolean startScan_private(Interval scanTime, BleManagerConfig.ScanFilter filter, BleManager.DiscoveryListener discoveryListener, boolean isPoll) 
      boolean startScan()
      Starts a scan that will continue indefinitely until stopScan() is called.
      boolean startScan(BleManager.DiscoveryListener discoveryListener)
      Same as startScan() but also calls setListener_Discovery(BleManager.DiscoveryListener) for you.
      boolean startScan(BleManagerConfig.ScanFilter filter)
      Calls startScan(Interval, BleManagerConfig.ScanFilter) with Interval.INFINITE.
      boolean startScan(BleManagerConfig.ScanFilter filter, BleManager.DiscoveryListener discoveryListener)
      Same as startScan() but also calls setListener_Discovery(BleManager.DiscoveryListener) for you.
      boolean startScan(Interval scanTime)
      Starts a scan that will generally last for the given time (roughly).
      boolean startScan(Interval scanTime, BleManager.DiscoveryListener discoveryListener)
      Overload of startScan(Interval, BleManagerConfig.ScanFilter, BleManager.DiscoveryListener)
      boolean startScan(Interval scanTime, BleManagerConfig.ScanFilter filter)
      Overload of startScan(Interval, BleManagerConfig.ScanFilter, BleManager.DiscoveryListener)
      boolean startScan(Interval scanTime, BleManagerConfig.ScanFilter filter, BleManager.DiscoveryListener discoveryListener)
      Same as startScan(Interval) but also calls setListener_Discovery(BleManager.DiscoveryListener) for you.
      void stopPeriodicScan()
      Stops a periodic scan previously started either explicitly with startPeriodicScan(Interval, Interval) or through the BleManagerConfig.autoScanActiveTime and BleManagerConfig.autoScanPauseInterval config options.
      void stopPeriodicScan(BleManagerConfig.ScanFilter filter)
      Same as stopPeriodicScan() but will also unregister any BleManagerConfig.ScanFilter provided through startPeriodicScan(Interval, Interval, BleManagerConfig.ScanFilter) or other overloads.
      void stopScan()
      Stops a scan previously started by startScan() or its various overloads.
      void stopScan(BleManagerConfig.ScanFilter filter)
      Same as stopScan() but also unregisters any filter supplied to various overloads of startScan() or startPeriodicScan(Interval, Interval) that take an BleManagerConfig.ScanFilter.
      String toString() 
      void turnOff()
      Disables BLE if manager is BleManagerState.ON.
      void turnOn()
      Enables BLE if manager is currently BleManagerState.OFF or BleManagerState.TURNING_OFF, otherwise does nothing.
      void turnOnWithIntent(Activity callingActivity, int requestCode)
      Convenience method to request your user to enable ble in a "standard" way with an Intent instead of using turnOn() directly.
      void unbondAll()
      Removes bonds for all devices that are BleDeviceState.BONDED.
      boolean undiscover(BleDevice device)
      Forcefully undiscovers a device, disconnecting it first if needed and removing it from this manager's internal list.
      void undiscoverAll()
      Undiscovers all devices that are BleDeviceState.DISCOVERED.
      void update(double timeStep_seconds)
      This method is made public in case you want to tie the library in to an update loop from another codebase.

    • Field Detail

      • appData

        public Object appData
        Field for app to associate any data it wants with the singleton instance of this class instead of having to subclass or manage associative hash maps or something. The library does not touch or interact with this data in any way.
        See Also:
        BleNode.appData, BleNode.appData

    • Method Detail

      • get

        public static BleManager get(Context context)
        Create the singleton instance or retrieve the already-created singleton instance with default configuration options set. If you call this after you call get(android.content.Context, BleManagerConfig) (for example in another Activity), the BleManagerConfig originally passed in will be used. Otherwise, if a new instance is to be created, this calls get(android.content.Context, BleManagerConfig) with a BleManagerConfig instance created using the default constructor BleManagerConfig.BleManagerConfig().
        Parameters:
        context -

      • get

        public static BleManager get(Context context,
                             BleManagerConfig config)
        Create the singleton instance or retrieve the already-created singleton instance with custom configuration options set. If you call this more than once (for example from a different Activity with different BleManagerConfig options set then the newer options overwrite the older options.
        Parameters:
        context -
        config -

      • turnOff

        public void turnOff()
        Disables BLE if manager is BleManagerState.ON. This disconnects all current connections, stops scanning, and forgets all discovered devices.

      • setListener_ConnectionFail_Server

        public void setListener_ConnectionFail_Server(BleServer.ConnectionFailListener listener_nullable)
        Convenience method to handle server connection fail events at the manager level. The listener provided will only get called if the server whose connection failed doesn't have a listener provided to BleServer.setListener_ConnectionFail(BleServer.ConnectionFailListener). This is unlike the behavior behind (for example) setListener_ServerState(BleServer.ServerStateListener) because BleServer.ConnectionFailListener.onEvent(BleServer.ConnectionFailListener.ConnectionFailEvent) requires a return value.
        Parameters:
        listener_nullable -
        See Also:
        BleServer.setListener_ConnectionFail(BleServer.ConnectionFailListener)

      • setListener_Incoming

        public void setListener_Incoming(BleServer.IncomingListener listener_nullable)
        Convenience method to handle server request events at the manager level. The listener provided will only get called if the server receiving a request doesn't have a listener provided to BleServer.setListener_Incoming(BleServer.IncomingListener) . This is unlike the behavior (for example) behind setListener_Outgoing(BleServer.OutgoingListener) because BleServer.IncomingListener.onEvent(BleServer.IncomingListener.IncomingEvent) requires a return value.
        Parameters:
        listener_nullable -
        See Also:
        BleServer.setListener_Incoming(IncomingListener)

      • setListener_ConnectionFail

        public void setListener_ConnectionFail(BleDevice.ConnectionFailListener listener_nullable)
        Convenience method to handle connection fail events at the manager level. The listener provided will only get called if the device whose connection failed doesn't have a listener provided to BleDevice.setListener_ConnectionFail(ConnectionFailListener). This is unlike the behavior behind setListener_DeviceState(BleDevice.StateListener) because BleDevice.ConnectionFailListener.onEvent(BleDevice.ConnectionFailListener.ConnectionFailEvent) requires a return value.
        Parameters:
        listener_nullable -
        See Also:
        BleDevice.setListener_ConnectionFail(BleDevice.ConnectionFailListener)

      • setListener_Bond

        public void setListener_Bond(BleDevice.BondListener listener_nullable)
        Convenience method to set a default back up listener for all BleDevice.BondListener.BondEvents across all BleDevice instances.
        Parameters:
        listener_nullable -

      • setListener_ReadWrite

        public void setListener_ReadWrite(BleDevice.ReadWriteListener listener_nullable)
        Sets a default backup BleDevice.ReadWriteListener that will be called for all BleDevice instances.

        TIP: Place some analytics code in the listener here.
        Parameters:
        listener_nullable -

      • setListener_NativeState

        public void setListener_NativeState(BleManager.NativeStateListener listener)
        Set a listener here to be notified whenever this manager's native BleManagerState changes.
        Parameters:
        listener -

      • startPeriodicScan

        public void startPeriodicScan(Interval scanActiveTime,
                              Interval scanPauseTime)
        Manually starts a periodic scan. This is the post-constructor runtime equivalent to setting BleManagerConfig.autoScanActiveTime and BleManagerConfig.autoScanPauseInterval, so see their comments for more detail. Calling this forever-after overrides the options you set in BleManagerConfig.
        Parameters:
        scanActiveTime -
        scanPauseTime -
        See Also:
        BleManagerConfig.autoScanActiveTime, BleManagerConfig.autoScanPauseInterval

      • stopPeriodicScan

        public void stopPeriodicScan()
        Stops a periodic scan previously started either explicitly with startPeriodicScan(Interval, Interval) or through the BleManagerConfig.autoScanActiveTime and BleManagerConfig.autoScanPauseInterval config options.

      • startScan

        public boolean startScan()
        Starts a scan that will continue indefinitely until stopScan() is called.
        Returns:
        true if scan started, false> otherwise - usually this means this manager is not BleManagerState.ON.

      • startScan

        public boolean startScan(BleManagerConfig.ScanFilter filter)
        Calls startScan(Interval, BleManagerConfig.ScanFilter) with Interval.INFINITE.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if scan started, false> otherwise - usually this means this manager is not BleManagerState.ON.

        Returns:
        true if scan started, false> otherwise - usually this means this manager is not BleManagerState.ON.

      • pushWakeLock

        public void pushWakeLock()
        Requires the Manifest.permission.WAKE_LOCK permission. Gives you access to the internal wake lock as a convenience and eventually calls PowerManager.WakeLock.acquire().
        See Also:
        BleManagerConfig.manageCpuWakeLock

      • popWakeLock

        public void popWakeLock()
        Opposite of pushWakeLock(), eventually calls PowerManager.WakeLock.release().

      • ASSERT

        public boolean ASSERT(boolean condition)
        Fires a callback to BleManager.AssertListener if condition is false. Will post a Log.ERROR-level message with a stack trace to the console as well if BleManagerConfig.loggingEnabled is true.
        Parameters:
        condition -

      • ASSERT

        public boolean ASSERT(boolean condition,
                      String message)
        Same as ASSERT(boolean) but with an added message.
        Parameters:
        condition -
        message -

      • getStateMask

        public int getStateMask()
        Returns the abstracted bitwise state mask representation of BleManagerState for this device.
        See Also:
        BleManagerState

      • getNativeStateMask

        public int getNativeStateMask()
        Returns the native bitwise state mask representation of BleManagerState for this device. Similar to calling BluetoothAdapter.getState()
        See Also:
        BleManagerState

      • turnOn

        public void turnOn()
        Enables BLE if manager is currently BleManagerState.OFF or BleManagerState.TURNING_OFF, otherwise does nothing. For a convenient way to ask your user first see turnOnWithIntent(android.app.Activity, int).

      • reset

        public void reset()
        This is essentially a big red reset button for the Bluetooth stack. Use it ruthlessly when the stack seems to be acting up, like when you can't connect to a device that you should be able to connect to. It's similar to calling turnOff() then turnOn(), but also does other things like removing all bonds (similar to unbondAll()) and other "special sauce" such that you should use this method instead of trying to reset the stack manually with component calls.

        It's good app etiquette to first prompt the user to get permission to reset because it will affect Bluetooth system-wide and in other apps.
        See Also:
        BleManagerState.RESETTING

      • reset

        public void reset(BleManager.ResetListener listener)
        Same as reset() but with a convenience callback for when the reset is completed and the native BLE stack is (should be) back to normal.
        Parameters:
        listener -
        See Also:
        BleManagerState.RESETTING

      • unbondAll

        public void unbondAll()
        Removes bonds for all devices that are BleDeviceState.BONDED. Essentially a convenience method for calling BleDevice.unbond(), on each device individually.

      • disconnectAll

        public void disconnectAll()
        Disconnects all devices that are BleDeviceState.CONNECTED. Essentially a convenience method for calling BleDevice.disconnect(), on each device individually.

      • disconnectAll_remote

        public void disconnectAll_remote()
        Same as disconnectAll() but drills down to BleDevice.disconnect_remote() instead.

      • undiscoverAll

        public void undiscoverAll()
        Undiscovers all devices that are BleDeviceState.DISCOVERED. Essentially a convenience method for calling BleDevice.undiscover(), on each device individually.

      • turnOnWithIntent

        public void turnOnWithIntent(Activity callingActivity,
                             int requestCode)
        Convenience method to request your user to enable ble in a "standard" way with an Intent instead of using turnOn() directly. Result will be posted as normal to Activity.onActivityResult(int, int, Intent). If current state is BleManagerState.ON or BleManagerState.TURNING_ON this method early outs and does nothing.
        Parameters:
        callingActivity -
        requestCode -

      • onResume

        public void onResume()
        Opposite of onPause(), to be called from your override of Activity.onResume() for each Activity in your application. See comment for onPause() for a similar explanation for why you should call this method.

      • onPause

        public void onPause()
        It's generally recommended to call this in your override of Activity.onPause() for each Activity in your application. This doesn't do much for now, just a little bookkeeping and stops scan automatically if BleManagerConfig.stopScanOnPause is true. Strictly speaking you don't *have* to call this method, but another good reason is for future-proofing. Later releases of this library may do other more important things in this method so it's good to have it being called just in case.

      • getApplicationContext

        public Context getApplicationContext()
        Returns the Application provided to the constructor.

      • stopScan

        public void stopScan()
        Stops a scan previously started by startScan() or its various overloads. This will also stop the actual scan operation itself that may be ongoing due to startPeriodicScan(Interval, Interval) or defined by BleManagerConfig.autoScanActiveTime, but scanning in general will still continue periodically until you call stopPeriodicScan().

      • stopScan

        public void stopScan(BleManagerConfig.ScanFilter filter)
        Same as stopScan() but also unregisters any filter supplied to various overloads of startScan() or startPeriodicScan(Interval, Interval) that take an BleManagerConfig.ScanFilter. Calling stopScan() alone will keep any previously registered filters active.
        Parameters:
        filter -

      • getDevices_previouslyConnected

      • getDevices

        public BleDeviceIterator getDevices()
        Returns all the devices managed by this class. This generally includes all devices that are either. BleDeviceState.ADVERTISING or BleDeviceState.CONNECTED.

        public BleDevice getDevice_next(BleDevice device)
        Same as getDevice_next(BleDevice, BleDeviceState) but just returns the next device in the internal list with no state checking.
        Parameters:
        device -

      • getDevice_previous

        public BleDevice getDevice_previous(BleDevice device,
                                    BleDeviceState state)
        Returns the first device previous to the provided one in the internal list that is in the given state. For various fringe cases like this manager not having any devices, this method returns BleDevice.NULL. This method wraps around so that if the provided device is at index 0, the returned device will be the last device this manager holds.
        Parameters:
        device -
        state -

      • getDevice_next

        public BleDevice getDevice_next(BleDevice device,
                                BleDeviceState state)
        Same as getDevice_previous(BleDevice, BleDeviceState) but returns the next device in the internal list with no state checking.
        Parameters:
        device -
        state -

        config -

      • newDevice

        public BleDevice newDevice(String macAddress,
                           String name,
                           BleDeviceConfig config)
        Creates a new BleDevice or returns an existing one if the macAddress matches. BleManager.DiscoveryListener.onEvent(DiscoveryEvent) will be called if a new device is created.

        NOTE: You should always do a BleDevice.isNull() check on this method's return value just in case. Android documentation says that underlying stack will always return a valid BluetoothDevice instance (which is required to create a valid BleDevice instance), but you really never know.
        Parameters:
        macAddress -
        name -
        config -

      • undiscover

        public boolean undiscover(BleDevice device)
        Forcefully undiscovers a device, disconnecting it first if needed and removing it from this manager's internal list. BleManager.DiscoveryListener.onEvent(DiscoveryEvent) with BleManager.DiscoveryListener.LifeCycle.UNDISCOVERED will be called. No clear use case has been thought of but the method is here just in case anyway.
        Parameters:
        device -
        Returns:
        true if the device was undiscovered, false if device is already BleDeviceState.UNDISCOVERED or manager doesn't contain an instance, checked referentially, not through BleDevice.equals(BleDevice) (i.e. by mac address).

        Parameters:
